clues.text: Some say this 2-word concept of desire & decision isn't real; experiments show people exposed to that viewpoint behave worse
Antisthenes has been credited with starting this Greek sect, now the -ism that says people are only out for themselves
"Man is by nature a political animal", wrote this ancient Greek in his "Politics"
Kant wrote "Critiques" of pure & practical this, the method of making logical correlations
2 basic approaches in this field are deontology (an act is inherently good or bad) & teleology (depends on the result)
His films included "King Creole" & "Girls! Girls! Girls!"
This late rapper played Lucky, a single father & love interest of Janet Jackson in "Poetic Justice"
As Breathless Mahoney in 1990's "Dick Tracy", she left Warren Beatty breathless on-screen & off
The movie "Sparkle" marked the film debut of Jordin Sparks & the final film of this superstar who played her mom
This rocker played Jareth, the Goblin King in the 1986 cult classic fantasy "Labyrinth"

rounds.comments: (Ken: Hispanic Heritage Month begins today, in fact.)

clues.text: Many in the U.S. from this island celebrate May 20 as its independence day in 1902; the Communist govt. uses a different day
In 2022 Chicago held the first Sueños Fest, devoted to this Latin music-reggae mix that began in Panama
Philadelphia has the USA's second-largest community from this U.S. commonwealth & a center for its culture
Julia Alvarez explores the Yankee-ization of an event for teenage girls in "Once Upon a" this: "Coming of Age in the USA"
Those from this S. Amer. country, like conductor Gustavo Dudamel, were the fastest-growing Hispanic-American group 2010-2020

Abraham Lincoln:
"A ____ divided against itself cannot stand"

Julius Caesar:
"The ____ is cast"

Attributed to Emiliano Zapata:
"Better to die on your feet than live on your ____"

Gandhi:
"You can return blow for blow if you are not brave enough to follow the path of ____"

Joseph Welch to Senator McCarthy:
"Have you no sense of ____"
This traditional 4-letter dog name is from Latin for "trust"
The name of a famous space dog, Laika is "barker" in this language
This 5-letter word meaning "wanderer" was popularized as a dog name by a 1905 silent film
President Garfield gave his dog this 4-letter name to honor what Rutherford B. Hayes had done to a bill
During World War I a corporal named 2 German Shepherds for French folk dolls: Nanette & this; the latter dog became a movie star
Norma Jeane Mortenson, later Baker
"When Harry Met Sally...", Sally used to be Margaret Mary Emily Hyra
Fast & Furious family man Mark Sinclair
Eric Marlon Bishop shocked Spider-Man as Electro
Carlos Estévez, from an acting family
This type of diet is modeled on the eating habits of prehistoric man
Where TV shows like "Jeopardy!" are taped; it's also a one-room apartment
This word for a type of pet adoptee implies it has been removed from danger
From the Italian, it's any smooth transition from one topic to another
There's a "Q" inside this synonym for abrupt
The action begins in a children's tale when this character blows into London's Cherry Tree Lane on the east wind
Part I of a 17th century novel is titled "The Ingenious Hidalgo" this character "of La Mancha"
It's the ironically happy-sounding name of the commander's barren wife in "The Handmaid's Tale"
These 2 migrant workers dream of owning a farm with rabbits in Steinbeck's "Of Mice and Men", but things don't go as planned
This title wolf dog in a 1906 novel has a father named One Eye & a mother named Kiche
2 main types of this in a divorce are legal (who makes big decisions about the kid's life) & physical (whom the moppet lives with)
In general, an NDA, short for this agreement, is not enforceable against you if you're testifying under subpoena
Many people trying to sue over the same thing may be certified as this group to prevent unfair variations in their outcomes
All states have implied consent laws, so applying for a driver's license means agreeing to let police test this
The 2022 Dobbs Supreme Court decision mentions these 9th Amendment rights, a term for those protected but not specified

On the periodic table: nihonium,
niobium...

In state capitals: Bismarck,
Boise...

As president:
Carter,
Cleveland...

Of the original 7 Sisters colleges:
Radcliffe,
Smith...

In AKC dog breeds:
Irish Terrier,
Irish Water Spaniel...
Long before Netflix, in 1998 a Hong Kong company invested $1.5 billion in video on demand, pioneering this kind of service
In 1991 this young broadcast TV network became the first in the U.S. to run a commercial for condoms
In 1974 this Broadcasting System, Inc. shortened things up & became CBS Inc.
In 1946 "Faraway Hill", about a widow in love with a man engaged to another woman, brought this genre to network television
A 1934 act of Congress established this agency, initially to regulate the radio, telephone & telegraph industries
This type of energy is sustainable but not yet renewable; it could be if we start getting the uranium from seawater
Let's dig up the fact that in 2021, this fossil fuel provided about 22% of U.S. electricity generation
Power source of the Stanley brothers' 1910 automobiles, per the name
The Energy Dept. says of this source, its "turbines don't produce atmospheric emissions that cause acid rain... or greenhouse gases"
This dam with the most generation capacity of any U.S. power plant is about a 2-hour drive from Spokane

rounds.text: In '60s speech to Congress he said, "All I have I would have gladly given not to be standing here today"
